skill.name: ng-alain Component Development
skill.description: Create components using ng-alain (@delon/abc) and ng-zorro-antd UI libraries. Use this skill when building enterprise UI features with ST (Simple Table), SF (Schema Form), ACL (Access Control), PageHeader, ReuseTab, and other @delon components. Ensures proper integration with ng-alain architecture, theming system, responsive layouts, and accessibility standards while following Angular 20 patterns.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown content with inline code examples for reference. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no command execution. Safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Building enterprise Angular UI requires knowledge of ng-alain components, theming, and patterns. This skill provides ready-to-use code examples for ST tables, SF forms, ACL permissions, and responsive layouts following Angular best practices.
actual_capabilities: Generate ST (Simple Table) components with pagination, sorting, and action buttons
Create SF (Schema Form) components with dynamic validation and async data loading
Implement ACL (Access Control) for role-based UI visibility
Build responsive layouts using ng-zorro grid system with dark mode support
Create modals and drawers with form integration
Add page headers with breadcrumbs and action buttons
limitations: Requires existing ng-alain project setup with @delon packages installed
Does not generate full project scaffolding or configuration files
Does not include backend integration or API call implementations
Does not handle state management beyond component-level signals

use_cases.title: Enterprise Dashboard Components
use_cases.description: Build data-rich dashboards with tables, statistics cards, and responsive layouts using ng-zorro components.

use_cases.title: Form and Data Management
use_cases.description: Create complex forms with schema validation, async dropdowns, and modal integration for CRUD operations.

use_cases.title: Access Control Systems
use_cases.description: Implement role-based UI visibility with ACL directives and permission services across enterprise applications.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Table
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an ST table component with pagination that displays a list of users with columns for ID, name, email, status, and actions.

prompt_templates.title: Complex Form
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an SF schema form for a task management system with fields for title, description, status dropdown, priority radio buttons, assignee async select, due date picker, and tags input.

prompt_templates.title: Protected Actions
prompt_templates.prompt: Create Angular component with ACL permissions that shows Create, Edit, and Delete buttons only when users have the corresponding 'task:create', 'task:edit', and 'task:delete' permissions.

prompt_templates.title: Full Feature Page
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a complete task management page with page header, breadcrumb navigation, responsive statistics cards for task counts, and an ST table with filter, sort, and action buttons.

output_examples.input: Create an ST table component for displaying orders with order ID, customer name, total amount, status badge, and date columns
output: Generated OrderTableComponent with ST columns configuration
Added pagination with page size selector
Included status badges (pending, processing, shipped, delivered)
Added Edit and Delete action buttons with confirmation dialogs
Configured sorting on amount and date columns

best_practices: Use SHARED_IMPORTS to consolidate common ng-zorro and @delon module imports across components
Implement responsive breakpoints (nzXs, nzSm, nzMd, nzLg) for mobile-first layouts
Add proper ARIA labels and accessibility attributes for keyboard navigation
anti_patterns: Avoid hardcoding magic numbers for column widths - use responsive breakpoints instead
Do not skip loading states during async data fetching
Avoid mixing template-driven and reactive forms without clear separation

faq.question: Which Angular versions are supported?
faq.answer: This skill targets Angular 17+ with standalone components. Angular 20 patterns (signals, control flow) are used throughout.

faq.question: What is the difference between ST and SF?
faq.answer: ST (Simple Table) handles data display with pagination and sorting. SF (Schema Form) generates dynamic forms from JSON schemas.

faq.question: How does ACL integration work?
faq.answer: ACL uses *aclIf directive to conditionally render elements based on permission strings. The ACLService provides programmatic checks.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only provides code templates. No data is collected, transmitted, or stored. All code runs locally in your project.

faq.question: Why are my components not rendering?
faq.answer: Ensure you imported required modules (SHARED_IMPORTS) and added component to imports array. Check browser console for template errors.

faq.question: How does this compare to raw ng-zorro?
faq.answer:: ng-alain adds enterprise abstractions like ST tables, SF forms, and ACL on top of ng-zorro, reducing boilerplate for common patterns.
